wikipedia_page.main: Malcolm Newlands (28 March 1925 – 10 February 1996) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper.

response: Bobby Brown, Malcolm Newlands, Jimmy Fleming, Dennis Stokoe and Jack Bertolini were all recognised by the Football League and played in the Football League Third Division North vs. South Representative Games during the 1950s.

link_mentions.page: Football League Third Division North versus South representative matches

response: In October 1952, Thompson joined Preston North End, replacing Malcolm Newlands, and made his debut in a 5–2 victory at Portsmouth on 25 October. He made 30 appearances during the 1952–53 season, keeping ten clean sheets, as Preston finished runners-up to Arsenal for the First Division title. On 14 February 1953, Preston North End were playing Sheffield Wednesday at Deepdale; Derek Dooley was chasing a long pass from Albert Quixall when he collided with Thompson just as he made contact with the ball, breaking the centre-forward's leg in two places. Dooley never recovered from his injuries with gangrene setting into his leg, and as a result had to have his right leg amputated just above the knee, thus ending his playing career.
